path_api_key.description: The key that uniquely identifies an API key for a user
path_api_key.name: api_key

path_invite_token.description: The identifier of a user invite, also known as token
path_invite_token.name: invite_token

path_user_id_or_email.description: ID or email address of the user
path_user_id_or_email.name: user_id_or_email

query_auditlog_action.description: The logs can be filtered by their action using this query parameter.
query_auditlog_action.name: action

query_auditlog_cluster_id.description: The logs can be filtered by the cluster involved.
query_auditlog_cluster_id.name: cluster_id

query_azure_secret_id.description: The organization secret_id that holds the Azure access key that will be used to try to retrieve the Azure Blob Storage containers and blobs.
query_azure_secret_id.name: secret_id

query_credit_status.description: Status the credits will be filtered by.
query_credit_status.name: status

query_end.description: Date used to filter the operations returned. It must adhere to the following format: 2021-11-16T13:00:00Z
query_end.name: end

query_end_ts.description: End Timestamp Filter. Format ISO 8601. YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ssZ]
query_end_ts.name: end

query_endpoint.description: Optional. The S3 compatible endpoint URL that will be used to retrieve the S3 buckets.
query_endpoint.name: endpoint

query_exclude_cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster to exclude
query_exclude_cluster_id.name: exclude_cluster_id

query_files_limit.description: The number of files returned.Use keywork 'ALL' to have no limit applied.
query_files_limit.name: limit

query_files_offset.description: The offset files to skip before beginning to return the files.
query_files_offset.name: offset

query_from_ts.description: From Timestamp Filter. Format ISO 8601. YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ssZ]
query_from_ts.name: from

query_last.description: For pagination this query parameter can be provided. The value should be the id of the oldest element in the previous result.
query_last.name: last

query_minutes_ago.description: The number of minutes of data to retrieve. Overrides 'start'.
query_minutes_ago.name: minutes_ago

query_product_name.description: The products can be filtered by their name using this query parameter.
query_product_name.name: name

query_product_offer.description: The products can be filtered by their offer using this query parameter.
query_product_offer.name: offer

query_product_plan.description: The products can be filtered by their plan using this query parameter.
query_product_plan.name: plan

query_product_tier.description: The products can be filtered by their tier using this query parameter.
query_product_tier.name: tier

query_region.description: Specific region of the product to query.
query_region.name: region

query_secret_id.description: The organization secret_id that holds the AWS access key that will be used to try to retrieve the S3 buckets.
query_secret_id.name: secret_id

query_specific_product_name.description: Specific product name of the product to query.
query_specific_product_name.name: product_name

query_specific_product_offer.description: Specific product offer of the product to query.
query_specific_product_offer.name: product_offer

query_specific_product_plan.description: Specific product plan of the product to query.
query_specific_product_plan.name: product_plan

query_specific_product_tier.description: Specific product tier of the product to query.
query_specific_product_tier.name: product_tier

query_specific_product_unit.description: Specific product unit of the product to query.
query_specific_product_unit.name: product_unit

query_start.description: Date used to filter the operations returned. It must adhere to the following format: 2021-11-16T13:00:00Z
query_start.name: start

query_start_ts.description: Start Timestamp Filter. Format ISO 8601. YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ssZ]
query_start_ts.name: start

query_statuses.description: Statuses that the operations will be filtered by. It can be specified several times to filter by several statuses.
query_statuses.name: statuses

query_to_ts.description: To Timestamp Filter. Format ISO 8601. YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ssZ]
query_to_ts.name: to

errors.description: Property names equal to the field names that occured an error.

message.description: A human readable message explaining the error.
A human readable message explaining the error.
A human readable message explaining the error.
A human readable message explaining the error.
A human readable message explaining the error.

fqdn.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name. Note the trailing dot.

running_operation.description: The type of the currently running operation. Returns an empty string if there is no operation in progress.

non_sensitive_data.description:
Depending on the type of the operation, it contains the following data:
- SCALE: current_product_unit, current_num_nodes, target_product_unit and target_num_nodes
- UPGRADE: current_version and target_version- ALLOWED_CIDR_UPDATE: current_ip_whitelist and target_ip_whitelist

remaining_amount.description: Remaining credit amount in USD cents

ip.description: The IP address of the user

nightly.description: The latest nightly CrateDB version. This can be deployed if the nightly channel is specified.

stable.description: The latest stable CrateDB version. This will be used by default in all new deployments.

testing.description: The latest testing CrateDB version. This can be deployed if the testing channel is specified.

email.description: Notification email to use for the organization.

plan_type.description: The support plan to use for the organization.

email.description: Notification email to use for the organization.

plan_type.description: The support plan to use for the organization.

backup_location.description: Specify a custom backup location (custom s3 bucket) for a project. Supported in Edge regions only.
Specify a custom backup location (custom s3 bucket) for a project. Supported in Edge regions only.

get.description: This API has overrides for each of the billing providers. They are all the same.
get.summary: Retrieves subscription details

patch.summary: Modify a subscription. Allows changing the plan.

get.description: This API has overrides for each of the billing providers. They are all the same.
get.summary: Retrieves subscription details

get.description: Superusers can use this to view all clusters. For regular users, what is returned depends on their permissions.
get.summary: Lists all clusters visible to the current user

head.description: Helper endpoint to validate the availability and correctness of a cluster name.

400.description: Invalid name. Name doesn't seem to be URL safe.

head.summary: Checks for availability of the given cluster name

delete.description: Subscription behavior depends on the provider. For Azure subscriptions, it will also cancel the subscription. Will always send the final usage reports as part of the deletion operation.

get.summary: Returns information about a cluster

patch.description: Only changing the password is supported.

get.description: Lists all the products that the specified cluster can be updated to.

200.description: Returns a list of available products

get.summary: List all the products a cluster can be updated to.

get.description:
Lists all the available CrateDB versions considered stable that the specified cluster
can be upgraded to.
Downgrades are not supported.
Major version upgrades are not supported.
Minor version upgrades are only supported to the immediately next minor version.
get.summary: List all the possible CrateDB versions a cluster can be directly upgraded to.

put.description:
Triggers a update backup schedule operation on the given cluster.

Can change the backup hours of the clusters backup schedule. The payload needs to
contain new backup hours the cluster backup schedule should have.
put.summary: Change the backup hours of the cluster backup schedule.

put.description: Allows to enable/disable deletion protection for a cluster. This is an additional safety feature. If deletion protection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted until it is disabled.
put.summary: Controls a clusters deletion protection status

200.description: Returns the list of export jobs

get.summary: Lists export jobs for the given cluster
Returns information about an export job

200.description: Returns the list of import jobs

get.summary: Lists import jobs for the given cluster
Returns information about an import job
Shows progress of the given import job

put.description: Allows adding an array of CIDRs which are allowed to access the cluster. Any CIDR not included in one of the ranges provided will be prevented from accessing the cluster. Each time the API is called the old CIDR are overwritten with the CIDRs passed in the new payload.
put.summary: Updates the clusters IP whitelist with the payload provided in the request

200.description: Returns the JWT access and refresh token for this cluster

get.summary: Generate a JWT for cluster access (Grand Central)

schema.description: Property names depend on the type of metrics.

200.description: Returns metric data of a cluster for a given metric id

get.summary: Returns metrics for a cluster

delete.description: In some cases, it might be required to bounce a CrateDB node, for example if there are stuck queries.

202.description: Returns the status of node deletion

delete.summary: Restarts the given node in the cluster

get.description:
Returns a list of operations that belong to the specified cluster.
Cluster operations provide their state so they can be used, for instance, to determine
if a cluster upgrade has been finished.

200.description: Returns a list of cluster operations.

get.summary: List all the operations that belong to the specified cluster.

put.description:
Triggers a change product operation on the given cluster.

Can change the product of the cluster. The payload needs to contain the product
name the cluster should changed to.

Triggers a scaling operation on the given cluster.

Can scale the cluster up or down. The cluster's product type must support the given
scale unit. Supported scale units can be retrieved from the Products API.

200.description:
Returns the cluster. Note the product_unit and num_nodes fields will not
be updated until the cluster has successfully completed the scaling operation.
To monitor the progress of a scaling operation please use the operations cluster
subresource.

get.description:
Allows listing the backups for the given cluster. This will list all historic snapshots, however only the last 2 weeks are kept by default in the actual backup location. Snapshots are returned in descending order (latest first).
Snapshots are not rotated while a cluster is suspended.
Please note that while arbitrary time intervals can be passed to this API, it will only ever return a window of snapshots that is 2 weeks wide going back from the latest snapshot in the given time range.

200.description: Returns the list of snapshots taken on the cluster in descending order.

get.summary: Lists snapshots (backups)

post.description:
The repository and snapshot names can be retrieved from the Snapshots API.

Note that for a snapshot restore operation to work, the table to be restored
must not exist (i.e. must be dropped first).

This will return immediately, but the restore operation might take some time,
depending on the size of the table being restored.

put.description:
Triggers a storage expansion operation on the given cluster.

The cluster's product type must support custom storage.

200.description:
Returns the cluster. Note `disk_size_per_node_bytes` from hardware-specs fields will not
be updated until the cluster has successfully completed the operation.
To monitor the progress of an operation please use the operations cluster
subresource.

put.description:
Triggers a suspend operation on the given cluster.

Can suspend the cluster or reinstate it. The payload needs to contain the boolean if
the cluster should be suspended or reinstated. Only clusters with the products `cr1-4`
can be suspended.

Triggers an upgrade operation on the given cluster.

The given crate_version must be available in the same channel: i.e. it is not
possible to upgrade from a stable version to a testing/nightly version.

Only minor and hotfix version upgrades are currently allowed.

Downgrades are only supported to earlier hotfix releases.

200.description: Returns the cluster. Note the crate_version field will not be updated until the cluster has successfully completed the upgrade operation. To monitor the progress of an upgrade operation please use the operations cluster subresource.

get.summary: Returns a list of available configurations
Returns the value of a configuration key

get.summary: Returns the feature flags

get.description: Lists all the S3 buckets the given organization secret_id has access to.

200.description: Returns a list of S3 buckets that can be used to import data. If the attempt to gather the bucket names failed, an error message is provided describing the reason.

get.summary: List all the S3 buckets the given organization secret_id has access to.

get.description: List all the S3 objects in a specific bucket.

200.description: List all the S3 objects in a specific bucket. If the attempt to gather the objects names failed, an error message is provided describing the reason. The results can be filtered by prefix. Returns maximum 1000 files.

get.summary: List all the S3 objects in a specific bucket.

get.description:
Lists all the Azure Blob Storage containers the given organization secret_id has
access to.

200.description: Returns a list of Azure Blob Storage containers that can be used to import data. If the attempt to gather the container names failed, an error message is provided describing the reason.

get.summary: List all the Azure Blob Storage containers the given organization secret_id has access to.

get.description: List all the Azure Blob Storage blobs in a specific container.

200.description: Returns a list of Azure Blob Storage blobs in a specific container. If the attempt to gather the blobs names failed, an error message is provided describing the reason. Returns maximum 5000 files.

get.summary: List all the Azure Blob Storage blobs in a specific container.

post.description: Provision a new cluster, optionally creating a project as well. A valid subscription must be provided, or a cluster can be provisioned by a superuser w/o a subscription.

get.description: This exposes a Prometheus-compatible endpoint that can be configured as a scrape target in a Prometheus instance. Please note that this API is rate-limited to one request per minute. You may configure a higher scrape interval, but will not receive updated data more than once a minute.

200.description: Returns cluster metric data of an organization

get.summary: Returns prometheus metrics for the clusters of an organization

get.description:
A payment method is a way of paying for your CrateDB Cloud cluster. It is sometimes used interchangeably to refer to a subscription, but that is not entirely true. In the case of Stripe, you're actually paying with a specific credit card.
This encapsulates all the business logic around what payment methods are available and shown to the user.
When deploying clusters, a specific subscription still needs to be specified.
get.summary: Lists payment methods belonging to this Organization
Get a list of projects the user is a member of filtered by organization

get.description: Quotas provide limits to some actions. This endpoint returns a list of the quotas that apply to the given organization, with the current value and the quota value for each.
get.summary: Lists all quotas for the given organization
Lists all regions visible to the current user by organization

get.description: Returns the remaining monthly budget an organization can spend for deploying new clusters or scaling up existing clusters.
get.summary: Returns the remaining budget of an organization.

get.description: An installation token is used to authenticate with CrateDB Cloud from the command line when installing an edge region. They are valid for 24 hours.
get.summary: Generates an install token for an Edge region

200.description: Returns the result of the verification

post.summary: Verifies backup location details. Supported in Edge regions only.

get.summary: Get a list of roles which can be assigned to a user

post.description: Setup Stripe subscription to pay by bank transfer

This is used by the UI when showing the "Add CC" form. The client secret returned
by this API is used by the Stripe JS library to request that a card be added
to this customer's account as well as a test $1 charge to make sure the card is valid.
Once the UI marks the PaymentIntent as completed it must call /validate-card/ endpoint
to refund the charge and mark the card as valid.

We do not store any card details.

This is used by the UI when showing the "Add CC" form. The client secret returned
by this API is used by the Stripe JS library to request that a card be added
to this customer's account.

We do not store any card details.

get.summary: Retrieve billing info

patch.description: Allows editing the customers billing info (address etc.).

get.description: We do not store any card info ourselves, this API always goes direct to Stripe.
get.summary: List customers cards on file with Stripe

delete.description: You cannot delete the last card on file.

patch.description: This only allows setting the card as default. It is not possible to update any other card details (CVV, expiry date...). A new card must be added instead.
patch.summary: Update a card on file with Stripe

post.description:
This is used by the UI when submitting the "Add CC" form. If the PaymentIntent
was successfully completed this endpoint refunds the PaymentIntent and marks the card
as validated so that it can be used with subscriptions.

We do not store any card details.

200.description: Card validated. Returns all the Stripe cards associated to the customer.

post.summary: Validates a Stripe card that has been charged with a Setup PaymentIntent.

get.description: If any promotions are applicable, they will be returned here. Note that only one promotion can be active per organization, and if one already is - this API will return nothing.
get.summary: List promotions applicable to this organization

delete.description:
BE CAREFUL! This will delete any clusters that the customer has running in this Subscription. Will also send the final usage reports.
Cancelling the subscription will mean that the outstanding amount due will be collected immediately.

get.summary: Retrieve upcoming invoice details
Lists subscriptions belonging to an organization

post.description: Must be called before attempting to deploy a cluster or adding credit card details.

delete.description:
BE CAREFUL! This will delete any clusters that the customer has running in this Subscription. For Stripe it will also send the final usage reports.
Cancelling the subscription will mean that the outstanding amount due will be collected immediately.
This works only for subscriptions of type 'contract' or 'stripe'.
